currentDoc: Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year "

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster "

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like

I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashi

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm."

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And on

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're al"

 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government""

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm."

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated"

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs w"

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they."

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species.  "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked wel

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. W

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm."

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like t

I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the da

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it Geo

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are liste

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of danger

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. THe

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. THe next day the p

 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go o

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radia

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And th

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing,

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowi

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm."

 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

"Too bad a

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

"Too bad about them, they wer

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy.

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

"Too bad about them, they were good with the machines," said the h

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy.

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

"Too bad about them, they were good with the machines," said the high wizard of the council. "But we just can't have ele

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy.

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

"Too bad about them, they were good with the machines," said the high wizard of the council. "But we just can't have elements like that in

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy.

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

"Too bad about them, they were good with the machines," said the high wizard of the council. "But we just can't have elements like that in the new world."  A

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

"Too bad about them, they were good with the machines," said the high wizard of the council. "But we just can't have elements like that in the new world."  And with that he ret

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

"Too bad about them, they were good with the machines," said the high wizard of the council. "But we just can't have elements like that in the new world."  And with that he returned to the new facility, secure i

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

"Too bad about them, they were good with the machines," said the high wizard of the council. "But we just can't have elements like that in the new world."  And with that he returned to the new facility, secure in his own power an

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

Ann, the middle aged mechanical engineer turned all around mechanic, looked over at the training grounds. They were alight with fire and ice and flying debris. "Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Never thought I would see something positive come from an alien invasion. I mean, I'm not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing, but it's something."

Her companion George shook his head. "I don't know what to think. Magic is back and all it took was the near extinction of the human species. I'm not sure if I should be happy or sad. 5 year old me would have been ecstatic, 45 year old me who lost most of his friends and family, hell most of the world just can't seem to muster up enthusiasm." 

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

"Too bad about them, they were good with the machines," said the high wizard of the council. "But we just can't have elements like that in the new world."  And with that he returned to the new facility, secure in his own power and the futur

Ann nodded her head. "Yeah, and it's not like it is good for everyone. Or that it helped with the aliens. A good old fashioned nuclear holocaust was what did them in. And a lot of us."
George looked over at the training grounds.
 "And only, what 1 in 5 of the survivors have any real power. And what about the rest of us? We're just going to be left behind. We're already locked out of most of the new "government" positions, and relegated to doing whatever jobs we are given. While they..."

Trainee emerged from the training grounds laughing. They were well dressed, looked well fed, clean and happy. 

"Hey look, it's the new elite. Looks like they are done for the day while we, "

"Can it George. You know talking bad about the magic users is frowned on. And you never know if they are listening - lots of them have magic that can spy from a distance. And there are still a lot of dangerous jobs out there that you don;t want to get assigned to."

But it was too late. Someone had heard. The next day the pair found themselves with orders to go on a salvage run to NYC, one of the places with the highest radiation levels. And there was no refusing. They left knowing that they probably wouldn't be coming back.

"Too bad about them, they were good with the machines," said the high wizard of the council. "But we just can't have elements like that in the new world."  And with that he returned to the new facility, secure in his own power and the future he was creating

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.
